text: GATA transcription factors associate with a novel class of nuclear bodies in erythroblasts and megakaryocytes .
The nuclear distribution of GATA transcription factors in murine haemopoietic cells was examined by indirect immunofluorescence .

Specific bright foci of <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> fluorescence were observed in erythroleukaemia cells and primary murine erythroblasts and megakaryocytes , in addition to diffuse nucleoplasmic localization .

text: These foci , which were preferentially found adjacent to nucleoli or at the nuclear periphery , did not represent sites of active transcription or binding of <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to consensus sites in the <extra_id_0> beta-globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> loci .

text: Immunoelectron microscopy demonstrated the presence of intensely labelled structures likely to represent the <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> foci seen by immunofluorescence .

The <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> nuclear bodies differed from previously described nuclear structures and there was no co-localization with nuclear antigens involved in RNA processing or other ubiquitous ( Spl , <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) or haemopoietic ( NF-E2 ) transcription factors .

text: Interestingly , <extra_id_0> GATA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins also localized to the same nuclear bodies in cell lines co-expressing <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> -2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> -3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene products .

text: This pattern of distribution is , thus far , unique to the GATA transcription factors and suggests a protein - protein interaction with other components of the nuclear bodies via the GATA zinc finger domain .
